required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Traxi Panniculus Retractor on Surgical Time at Non-emergent Cesarean Delivery in Obese Women
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Traxi Panniculus Retractor on Surgical Time at Non-emergent Cesarean Delivery in Obese Women

brief_summary.textblock: This is an unblinded, randomized control trial of obese women to evaluate the impact of the Traxi Panniculus Retractor (TPR) on the cesarean operative time and surgical blood loss when compared to silk tape.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess whether using the Traxi Panniculus Retractor during cesarean section, in obese (BMI greater than or equal to 30kg/m2 at time of delivery) women, can decrease the cesarean operative time compared to using silk tape to retract the panniculus. Operative time is defined as the time from when the patient lies on the operating room table (at completion of the epidural/spinal anesthesia) until fascial closure.

primary_outcome.measure: Time from when a subject lies on the OR table to fascial closure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time from when a subject lies on the OR table to fascial closure

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from skin incision to delivery
time from skin incision to closure of fascia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: skin incision to closure of fascia

secondary_outcome.measure: time from skin incision to skin closure

arm_group.description: Surgeon will use the Traxi Panniculus Retractor to retract the panniculus during cesarean section.
Surgeon will use silk tape to retract the panniculus during cesarean section.

intervention.description: Surgeon uses the Traxi Panniculus Retractor (TPR) surgical retraction device to retract the panniculus during C-Section.
Surgeon uses silk tape to retract the panniculus during C-Section.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Current BMI equal to or greater than 30 kg/m2 at last prenatal visit or on day of admission to L&D
- Requires panniculus retractor for cesarean delivery, as determined by the surgeon
- Non-emergent cesarean delivery
- Spinal or epidural anesthesia
- Low transverse skin incision
- Gestational age equal to or more than 32 weeks 0 days
- Singleton pregnancy
- Three or less previous cesarean deliveries.
- English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of Alexis or any other retractor
- General anesthesia
- Fetal demise
- Placenta previa
- History of bariatric surgery
- Adhesive allergy
